thread.title: Prince Charles Warns on WW2 Lessons as Trump Visit Spurs Outrage
thread.title_full: Prince Charles Warns on WW2 Lessons as Trump Visit Spurs Outrage

author: Robert Hutton
title: Prince Charles Warns on WW2 Lessons as Trump Visit Spurs Outrage
text:
Prince Charles Warns on WW2 Lessons as Trump Visit Spurs Outrage Bloomberg 11 hrs ago Robert Hutton Click to expand Replay Video Watch Trump's full speech announcing SCOTUS nominee President Trump has chosen Colorado appeals court judge Neil Gorsuch as his pick for the Supreme Court. The Washington Post Trump nominates Judge Gorsuch to U.S. Supreme Court Reuters Democrats boycott Senate hearing for Mnuchin, Price Democrats boycotted a hearing of the Senate Finance Committee in which Steven Mnuchin, President Trump's nominee for Treasury secretary, and Rep. Tom Price (R-Ga.), President Trump's nominee for health and human services secretary, would have likely been approved for consideration by the full Senate, on Jan. 31 at the Capitol. The Washington Post SETTINGS OFF HD HQ SD LO Prince Charles Gives Speech to Jewish Charity About Lessons from the Past Not Being Learned People See more videos SHARE SHARE TWEET SHARE EMAIL What to watch next Watch Trump's full speech announcing SCOTUS nominee The Washington Post 7:21 Trump nominates Judge Gorsuch to U.S. Supreme Court Reuters 3:08 Democrats boycott Senate hearing for Mnuchin, Price The Washington Post 2:44 EU leader warns of Trump threat CNN 1:32 Nikki Haley: Iran's Ballistic Missile Test 'Absolutely Unacceptable' NBC News 1:45 State Department 'dissent channel' memo opposes travel ban FOX News 5:15 Bannon at odds on Islam, China with decades of U.S. foreign policy doctrine USA TODAY 0:53 Senate Judiciary Committee spars on Sessions's nomination The Washington Post 2:45 On frontline of Europe's 'forgotten war' BBC News 1:54 Homeland Security's Kelly: 'This is not a ban on Muslims' The Washington Post 3:03 More than $121G raised for 110-year-old World War II vet to stay at home FOX News 3:00 Iraqi PM Calls Trump Travel Ban 'an Offence to Iraq' NBC News 0:37 The Mars Rover Found a Meteorite Made of Iron NBC News 1:11 Paul Ryan: Travel ban rollout was confusing CBS News 13:51 Two Americans killed in first military raid under President Trump TODAY 1:09 Alleged Terror Mastermind Blames Trump for his Detention NBC News 1:13 UP NEXT (Bloomberg) -- Prince Charles, the heir to the British throne, said he fears the lessons of World War II have been forgotten at a time his mother Queen Elizabeth II finds herself at the center of a dispute about whether President Donald Trump should have been invited to the U.K.
Trump’s ban on people traveling to the U.S. from seven Muslim-majority countries has sparked protests. In the U.K., 1.6 million people had signed a parliamentary petition calling for the invitation to be withdrawn. Prime Minister Theresa May says the state visit later this year will go ahead.
“The work of World Jewish Relief enables us to rally together, to do what we can to support people practically, emotionally and spiritually,” the prince said in speech at a Jewish charity’s dinner on Monday night. “Particularly at a time when the horrific lessons of the last war seem to be in increasing danger of being forgotten.”
Queen Elizabeth II, who has famously never given an interview in her more than six decades as monarch, has steered clear of any political commentary. Her son, on the other hand, does speak out on issues he feels passionately about, such as climate change and religious persecution. In December, he decried the rise of an “aggressive” populism against minority faiths.
The Sunday Times reported that if the visit went ahead, Charles planned to confront Trump over global warming.
To contact the reporter on this story: Robert Hutton in London at rhutton1@bloomberg.net. To contact the editors responsible for this story: Alan Crawford at acrawford6@bloomberg.net, Flavia Krause-Jackson, Eddie Buckle
